project_descr: To strengthen service delivery and democratic governance through interventions to improve oversight & accountability; and utilize global networks and S-S Cooperation to expand local knowledge and facilitate access to good practices

outputs.output_descr: The purpose of the output is to enhance capacity of government oversight institutions such as Parliament, Provincial Offices of the Premier, Public Service Commission, Departments, local government and  communities including Civil Society Organisations (CSOs) to improve service delivery by (i) providing technical & advisory  support, and develop citizen participation and feedback tools to enhance accountability; (ii) facilitate the institutionalisation of UN Interangency Parliament Support;  and (iii) support the IEC electoral process to ensure broad and inclusive participation in governance processes .

donor_name: UNDP AS ADMINISTRATIVE AGENT FOR A JOINT PROGRAMME PASS THROUGH ARRANGEMENT
outputs.output_descr:
The joint United Nations programme was developed by UNCT in collaboration with the Department of Women, Children and Persons with Disability (DWCPD). Its primary purpose is to enable the UNCT to provide technical and advisory support services to the DWCPD that would strengthen its coordination role in accelerating the implementation of the UNCRPD and the promotion of the rights of women, children and people with disabilities in South Africa.

The partnership programme will support the Department to specifically achieve three complementary outcomes to: (1) strengthen M&E capacity for effective oversight and advocacy for promotion of rights of persons with disabilities; (2) establish a CRPD compliant legal and policy framework to implement provisions of the Convention in South Africa; and (3) reduce economic vulnerability of persons with disabilities. 

UNDP serves as the lead agency responsible for providing the overall coordination, oversight, M&E and reporting on the national rights of persons with disabilities programme, UNICEF provides technical expertise toward the empowerment, advancement and socio-economic development of people with disabilities, OHCHR provides support in mainstreaming disability rights into government policies, processes and programme, while technical expertise on the needs for women with disabilities will be sourced from UNFPA and UN Women.
